newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume firms slightly, prices mixed.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume firms slightly, prices mixed.

text.p: Traded volume on the Istanbul gold exchange climbed slightly to 1,430 kilos on Friday, from Thursday's 1,378 kilos on continued physical demand, dealers said.

Gold closed easier in dollar terms at $347.60 an ounce from $349.00 on Thursday, following trends in Europe. Gold values rose in lira terms to close at 1,547,500 lira per gram, compared to 1,539,000 on Thursday as the lira eased against the dollar.
The Turkish currency ended at 137,700 against the dollar, compared to the previous 136,950 lira, raising gold's lira value.
The exchange will be closed on Monday, May 19 due to a public holiday.
Most of the day's trade -- 1,360 kilos -- took place in the morning session and 73.4 percent of the total was traded in lira terms.
